Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: 防具屋「獣王のおきて」
Entry.EnglishText: Armor Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: 武器屋「烈刃」
Entry.EnglishText: Weapon Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: 首都バルカ
Entry.EnglishText: Capital City Balka

Entry.JapaneseText: 首都バルカ・装備品屋
Entry.EnglishText: Capital City Balka - Weapon Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: 装備品屋
Entry.EnglishText: Weapon Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: そんな素敵なドレスの上に 似合う防具なんてないわよ？
Entry.EnglishText: Your dress is too beautiful to cover with armor.

Entry.JapaneseText: カワイイんだから、 武器よりオシャレ、でしょ？
Entry.EnglishText: Wouldn't you rather be seen wearing that instead of armor?

Entry.JapaneseText: うちは防具屋ですけど、 何をお探しですか？
Entry.EnglishText: We're an armor shop. What is it that you want?

Entry.JapaneseText: いらっしゃい……ますか？
Entry.EnglishText: Wel...come?

Entry.JapaneseText: いらっしゃいませ。
Entry.EnglishText: Welcome.

Entry.JapaneseText: いらっしゃい……ませ。
Entry.EnglishText: Welcome...

Entry.JapaneseText: いらっしゃいませ。
Entry.EnglishText: Welcome.

Entry.JapaneseText: いらっしゃいませ。
Entry.EnglishText: Welcome.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 防具を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy Armor Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: また、どーぞ…… 別に来なくてもいいけど。
Entry.EnglishText: Come aga-... Actually, don't come back.

Entry.JapaneseText: また来てくださいね。
Entry.EnglishText: Come again!

Entry.JapaneseText: また来てくださいね。
Entry.EnglishText: Come again!

Entry.JapaneseText: 新入荷の品がありますけど……？ 見たいなら、どーぞ……
Entry.EnglishText: We've got new inventory in stock... If you want to take a look, be my guest...

Entry.JapaneseText: はぁ……
Entry.EnglishText: Ugh...

Entry.JapaneseText: 新入荷の品がありますよ。 買っていってくださいな。
Entry.EnglishText: We have new inventory in stock. Please, feel free to buy something.

Entry.JapaneseText: 毎度です、また来てください。
Entry.EnglishText: Thank you for your patronage, please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: 新入荷の品がありますよ。 買っていってくださいな。
Entry.EnglishText: We have new inventory in stock. Please, feel free to buy something.

Entry.JapaneseText: 毎度です、また来てください。
Entry.EnglishText: Thank you for your patronage, please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: また……来てもいいですけど、 来なくてもいいですよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Come again...but you don't have to if you don't want to...

Entry.JapaneseText: 毎度です、また来てください。
Entry.EnglishText: Thank you for your patronage, please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: また来てくださいね。
Entry.EnglishText: Come again!

Entry.JapaneseText: あんまりガジュマに うちの商品を買ってほしく ないのよね……
Entry.EnglishText: I don't really want to sell to Gajuma...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマと同じ空気を吸ってると 思うと耐えられないわ！
Entry.EnglishText: I can't stand the thought of even breathing the same air as a Gajuma.
Entry.Notes: maybe use "with a" instead of "as a"

Entry.JapaneseText: 引っ越したいけどお金もないし。 あっちのガジュマが出て行って くれるのを待ってるんだけど……
Entry.EnglishText: I want to relocate, but I don't have the money to do so. I'm hoping the Gajuma over there will leave instead.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマを差別すると 店の営業許可を取り消すって お達しがあったのよ……
Entry.EnglishText: I received a notice that if I were to discriminate against Gajuma, they would revoke my business license...

Entry.JapaneseText: だから、あなたにも防具は 売ってあげるけど……
Entry.EnglishText: ...So that's the only reason I'm willing to sell to you...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマを差別すると 店の営業許可を取り消すって お達しがあったの……
Entry.EnglishText: I received a notice that if I were to discriminate against Gajuma, they would revoke my business license...

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、ヒューマの仲間たちからは 絶対に売るなって言われるし……
Entry.EnglishText: ...But my Huma friends keep saying I need to stop selling to them...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマの客が来ない事を ひたすら願ってるのよ……
Entry.EnglishText: I just hope we don't get any Gajuma customers...

Entry.JapaneseText: 今の世の中、あなたみたいな か弱い子にこそ、防具が必要よ。
Entry.EnglishText: With the current state of the world, it's kids like you who need protective equipment.

Entry.JapaneseText: お安くしておくわよ。 ひとついかが？
Entry.EnglishText: I'll even give you a discount. Would you be interested?

Entry.JapaneseText: 本当はガジュマなんかに…… い、いえ……こっちの話……
Entry.EnglishText: You're a Gajuma, so I don't really... Oh, uh, never mind me...

Entry.JapaneseText: ゆっくり見ていってね……
Entry.EnglishText: Take your time and have a look...

Entry.JapaneseText: あなた、この街の人じゃ なさそうだけど、あまり外を 出歩かないほうがいいわよ。
Entry.EnglishText: It doesn't look like you're from around here, so I'll just let you know, you should keep your outings to a minimum.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマと見れば、ガジュマに 嫌がらせされるから、気をつけて。
Entry.EnglishText: Gajuma like harrassing whatever Huma they lay eyes on, so be careful.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマを差別すると 店の営業許可を取り消すって お達しがあったのよ……
Entry.EnglishText: I received a notice that if I were to discriminate against Gajuma, they would revoke my business license...

Entry.JapaneseText: だから、あなたにも防具は 売ってあげるけど……
Entry.EnglishText: ...So that's the only reason I'm willing to sell to you...
Entry.Notes: More literally might be "as such" or "Therefore" in the beginning, but I feel this is better at conveying his reluctance to sell to Eugene.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマを差別するなって お上から言われてるけど……
Entry.EnglishText: The powers that be have given us orders to not discriminate against Gajuma...

Entry.JapaneseText: 今、この街じゃ、ヒューマのほうが 差別されているようなものよ…… どうにも納得がいかないわ！
Entry.EnglishText: But now, it's more like the Huma are being discriminated against in this city... I find that unacceptable!

Entry.JapaneseText: あっちの武器屋さんに言われたの。 いがみ合ってる場合じゃないって。
Entry.EnglishText: The weapon shop owner over there spoke with me. He said we shouldn't be quarreling with one another right now...

Entry.JapaneseText: 互いの問題点はこれから じっくり話し合えばいい。 今は、この危機を乗り越えようって。
Entry.EnglishText: ...And that we should work out our differences from now on. But at the moment, we just need to get through this crisis.

Entry.JapaneseText: なんだか、嬉しいっていうか…… それでいいんだ、って思ったの。
Entry.EnglishText: Somehow, I was actually happy to hear him say that... Now I feel like things will be all right.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうぞ見ていってください。 冷やかしも大歓迎です。
Entry.EnglishText: Please take a look. Window shopping is also permitted.

Entry.JapaneseText: コ、コワイ…… 何の音……？
Entry.EnglishText: I-I'm scared... What's that sound...?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマの女に売るための なまくらな武器はうちにはないよ！ さっさと帰った！
Entry.EnglishText: We don't sell any dull weapons that a Huma woman like you would want to buy! Hurry up and leave!

Entry.JapaneseText: なんだね、なんか武器が 欲しいのかい？
Entry.EnglishText: What, you want some kind of weapon?

Entry.JapaneseText: でもあんたのような か細い女の子じゃ、 剣も振れないだろう？
Entry.EnglishText: Would a girl as scawny as you even be able to pick up a sword?

Entry.JapaneseText: いらっしゃーい！
Entry.EnglishText: Welcome!

Entry.JapaneseText: いらっしゃ……い……
Entry.EnglishText: Wel...come...

Entry.JapaneseText: いらっしゃーい！
Entry.EnglishText: Welcome!

Entry.JapaneseText: いらっしゃ……い……
Entry.EnglishText: Wel...come...

Entry.JapaneseText: いらっしゃーい！
Entry.EnglishText: Welcome!

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 武器を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy Weapons Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: またいらっしゃーい！
Entry.EnglishText: Come back anytime!

Entry.JapaneseText: もう来なくていいからな！
Entry.EnglishText: I'm fine with you not coming back!

Entry.JapaneseText: またいらっしゃーい！
Entry.EnglishText: Come back anytime!

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマ大歓迎ー！
Entry.EnglishText: All Gajuma are welcome here.

Entry.JapaneseText: 気に入ったのはあったかね。 ガジュマはまたいらっしゃーい！
Entry.EnglishText: Did you see anything you like? Gajuma are always welcome here!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマは……えーと…… 見たいなら見れば……？
Entry.EnglishText: A Huma, huh... Well, if you want to look, I guess you can...?

Entry.JapaneseText: はいはい、サイナラ。
Entry.EnglishText: Yeah, yeah, buh-bye.

Entry.JapaneseText: 新しい品が入ってるよ。 見ていっておくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: We've got some new items in stock. Feel free to check them out.

Entry.JapaneseText: 気に入ったのはあったかね。 またいらっしゃーい！
Entry.EnglishText: Did you see anything you like? You're always welcome here!

Entry.JapaneseText: 新しい品が入ってるけど…… 見たいなら見れば……？
Entry.EnglishText: We've got some new items in stock... Well, if you want, feel free to have a look...

Entry.JapaneseText: はいはい、サイナラ。
Entry.EnglishText: Yeah, yeah, buh-bye.

Entry.JapaneseText: 新しい品が入ってるよ。 見ていっておくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: We've got some new items in stock. Feel free to check them out.

Entry.JapaneseText: 気に入ったのはあったかね。 またいらっしゃーい！
Entry.EnglishText: Did you see anything you like? You're always welcome here!

Entry.JapaneseText: またいらっしゃーい！
Entry.EnglishText: Come back anytime!

Entry.JapaneseText: うちも商売だからね、 武器が売れればおお助かりさ。
Entry.EnglishText: We are a business, so normally we'd be happy to sell weapons to people...

Entry.JapaneseText: でも最近は、もめごとばかり。 そんな事に、うちの武器を 使われるのもいやだしさ……
Entry.EnglishText: But there's been a lot of fighting as of late. I don't want any of the weapons I've sold to be used for that purpose...

Entry.JapaneseText: 客には気をつけているよ。
Entry.EnglishText: So I've been very careful about who I sell to.

Entry.JapaneseText: いくら商売とはいえ、 ヒューマにはあまり武器を 売りたかないね。
Entry.EnglishText: Even though I want to do a lot of business, I don't want to sell to Huma all that much.

Entry.JapaneseText: どのヒューマを見ても、 ガジュマが憎いって顔をしてる。 襲われたらかなわんからな……
Entry.EnglishText: Everyone that I see has that look in their eyes that tells me they hate Gajuma... I don't want to get attacked by my own weapons...

Entry.JapaneseText: 本音を言うと、ヒューマに 武器を売りたくないんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: To be honest, I don't want to sell weapons to Huma...

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、うかつに差別をすると ミルハウスト将軍の下の監察官が 来て、厳しく取り締まられるんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: But if I carelessly discriminate, then General Milhausts's officers will crack down on my shop.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマに、ウチの武器は オススメできないね！
Entry.EnglishText: Don't recommend my weapons to any other Huma!

Entry.JapaneseText: できるだけ買わないでくれると、 こっちは大助かりさ！
Entry.EnglishText: It would be a huge favor to us if you bought as little as you can!

Entry.JapaneseText: ここんところ、街での争いも 減ったように見えるんだがね、 俺は安心しちゃいないよ……
Entry.EnglishText: There seems to be less fighting going on in the streets these days, but I'm still anxious.

Entry.JapaneseText: なぜなら、ウチの武器が 今まで以上にたくさん 売れているんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: Especially since I've sold more weapons than ever before...

Entry.JapaneseText: そのうち何か起こるよ。 あんたも気をつけたほうがいい。
Entry.EnglishText: I guarantee you something is about to happen. You better keep an eye out.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマは武器を買う前に、 防具を買ったほうがいいんじゃ ないのかい!?
Entry.EnglishText: Shouldn't a Huma like yourself buy armor before buying a weapon!?

Entry.JapaneseText: いや、特に意味はないがな。 ふん……
Entry.EnglishText: Erm, I wasn't implying anything with that. Hmph...

Entry.JapaneseText: 今は、種族同士がいがみ 合ってる場合じゃない……
Entry.EnglishText: Now is not the time to be fighting over race.

Entry.JapaneseText: そんな気がするんだよ…… 協力し合おう……明日のために。
Entry.EnglishText: At least, that's how I feel. We need to work together... for a better tomorrow!

Entry.JapaneseText: うちの商品は天下一品だ。 見たらきっと欲しくなるよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Our weapons are the best in the world. You'll want one once you see them.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何が起こってるんだ？ あんた、知ってるか？
Entry.EnglishText: What the hell is going on? You wouldn't happen to know, would you?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『獣面のヨロイ（非売品）』 獅子王と呼ばれ、武術に秀でていた 第十六代ガガーイ王の使っていた、 胸にライオンのレリーフが入った 大迫力のヨロイ。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Lion-Faced Armor - A sturdy set of armor with a lion engraved on its chest. It was worn by the 16th King of Callegea, Gagaai, who was also known as the Lion King. He was renowned for prowess in the martial arts.
Entry.Notes: Not sure if his name is Gagai, may want to reword too.
